oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various interviews - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of interviews with Grandpa Jones (performer), George Jones (performer), Cindy Walker (performer), Claude Gray (performer), Archie Campbell (performer), Flatt & Scruggs (performer), Harlan Howard (songwriter), and George Hamilton IV (performer), conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie introduces Grandpa Jones -- Grandpa Jones talks about all the records he has out - Jones talks about his yodeling -- Jones talks about being from Niagara, KY -- Jones talks about a time he was in the hospital at the same time as Stoney Cooper, because of a gull bladder removal -- Jones jokes about still buying his groceries on credit -- Jones talks about the year that he sold the most records, from 1949 to 1953 -- Collie concludes the interview -- Collie introduces George Jones -- George Jones talks about being from Beaumont, TX -- Jones talks about singing for as far back as he can remember -- Jones talks about picking up the guitar as a young child -- Jones talks about when he decided to make a career out of music -- Jones talks about his first recording coming out in 1954 -- Jones talks about preferring to sing country ballads -- Jones talks about singing duets with female vocalists -- Jones talks about a restaurant he owns -- Collie concludes the interview -- Collie introduces Cindy Walker -- Cindy Walker talks about knowing Biff for a long while -- Walker talks about Collie being a wonderful person and a great disc jockey -- Walker talks about some hit songs she has written -- Walker talks about randomly running into Biff and recording this interview -- Collie concludes the interview -- Collie introduces Claude Gray -- Claude Gray talks about thinking that Collie was a middle aged person based off his voice, but he is really younger -- Collie says he has always gotten that -- Gray talks about being taller than he looks in photos -- Collie concludes the interview -- Collie concludes the interview -- Collie introduces Archie Campbell -- Campbell talks about still playing on the Grand Ole Opry and working for a publishing company -- Collie concludes the interview -- Collie introduces Flatt & Scruggs -- Flatt talks about playing for various age groups and their reactions -- Flatt talks about the content of their music (incomplete) -- Biff Collie introduces George Hamilton IV and Harlan Howard -- Howard talks about playing with George Hamilton IV -- Hamilton talks about his touring and traveling through Canada -- Hamilton talks about Biff inspiring him to keep certain records -- Hamilton talks about his family and having a George Hamilton V at home -- Hamilton talks about his family name being passed down, ever since the 1800s -- Collie concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jones, George, 1931-2013; Walker, Cindy, 1918-2006; Gray, Claude; Campbell, Archie, 1914-1987; Flatt, Lester, 1914-1979; Scruggs, Earl, 1924-2012; Hamilton, George, IV, 1937-;
